comment._content: Clarence W. Sessions. Judge, U. S. District Court, Western District of Michigan. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clarence_W._Sessions

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: In NYT of April 5, 1914, query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50F10FA3D5E13738... "GRAND RAPIDS, Mich., April 4. -- Decision as to the winner in the first open battle between the new Federal Baseball League and organized baseball as represented by the National League is now up to the umpire, Judge Clarence W. Sessions, of the United States District Court for western Michigan. " Earlier, in Marc 21, 1914 NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F00811FD3D5E13738... The case appears to be an attempt by the Federal League to get "an injunction to restrain William J. Killifer, Jr., formerly catcher of the Philadelphia Nationals, from playing baseball with any other than the Chicago Federals." The issue was a "reserve clause" in his previous contract with the Philadelphia team. It looks as though "Killifer" should possibly have been "Killefer". See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Killefer which mentions the case.
